link.title: Lunches Available for Students During School Closures – Rising Tide Charter Public School

Governor Baker Closes Schools in Massachusetts until April 7
Monday Update from Head of School

div.h1: Lunches Available for Students During School Closures

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-3a0fb25f elementor-mobile-align-center elementor-align-left elementor-widget elementor-widget-post-info
has_eae_slider elementor-element elementor-element-1362a7b elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-inner-column

section.class: has_eae_slider elementor-element elementor-element-6d6ada0c elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.class: has_eae_slider elementor-element elementor-element-241eef35 elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column

div.div: Beginning on Monday, March 16, “grab and go” lunch and breakfast will be available, free of charge, for any Rising Tide student. No documentation will be required for students to pick up lunch and breakfast.
The meals are being provided, Monday through Friday during the school closure, by the food services of the Plymouth Public Schools, the vendor for school breakfast and lunch at Rising Tide.

Meals can be picked up between 11:30 and 12:30 each day at Hedge Elementary School, located at 258 Standish Avenue in Plymouth. Students should enter around the back of the building through the blue cafeteria door across from the playground.
Please do not congregate at Hedge Elementary School before or after picking up the meal, and practice social distancing when picking up the meal, remaining six feet from others.
